initialize(address).details: only owner can initialize, and the ownership is removed after that

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

processResponse(bytes32,uint256).details: function to process the oracle response (only callable from oracle)

params.newOwner_: the address who can retrieve the nft (if 0 assumes is not withdrawable)
params.requestId: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

processResponseForChange(bytes32,bool).details: function to process the oracle response (only callable from oracle)

params.changeable: the response telling us if this tokens are changeable
params.requestId: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

verifyTokenIsChangeable(address,uint256,.details: call to verify if a token is changable in the synthetic collection, this method can be called only from the nft vault contract

params.tokenFrom: the id of the nft in the collection to change from
params.tokenTo: the id of the nft in the collection to change to

returns.requestId: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle

verifyTokenIsWithdrawable(address,uint25.details: call to verify if a token is withdrawble in the synthetic collection, this method can be called only from the nft vault contract

params.tokenId: the id of the nft in the collection

returns.requestId: the id of the request to the Chainlink oracle
